Not Taking Over the World

with Julia Ebert

Hello, World.

I'm a neuroscientist and (technically) an engineer by training. By day I work on robots; by night I work on cinnamon rolls and Lego.

I've let my writing lapse, so I am using this blog as a way to develop my voice, science writing skills, and a writing habit. But mostly, I get distracted by trying to make the website itself look nice.

  • Welcome to Jekyll (#2)

    2018 January 24

    You’ll find this post in your _posts directory. Go ahead and edit it and re-build the site to see your changes. You can rebuild the site in many different ways, but the most common way is to run jekyll serve, which launches a web server and auto-regenerates your site when a file is updated.

    2015 June 19

    Taken from the readme file of the project’s Github repository)

    A Jekyll theme built with Google’s Polymer library and following the material design specifications.

  • Welcome to Jekyll!

    2015 June 8

    You’ll find this post in your _posts directory. Go ahead and edit it and re-build the site to see your changes. You can rebuild the site in many different ways, but the most common way is to run jekyll serve --watch, which launches a web server and auto-regenerates your site when a file is updated.
